title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Library Instruction Guide: Strategies for Utilizing Mathematical Research Materials

context.prior_knowledge: Basic library utilization experience and foundational knowledge in mathematics
context.additional_context: Intensive learning of systematic methods for exploring library resources to conduct mathematical research tasks

learning_goals: Learners can independently navigate core academic journals in mathematics using search strategies within three steps.
Learners can efficiently narrow search results by over 80% using database filtering functions to minimize cognitive load.
Learners can distinguish and select three types of reference materials (academic journals, theses, statistical data) aligned with research objectives.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
